title: How to Make Coconut Noodles

steps.headline: Heat up 1 liter (0.3 US gal) of water.
steps.description: When it's already boiled, put down the noodle and wait until the noodle is soft and cooked.

steps.headline: Pour down the cooked noodle in a bowl and add cold water in it until all of the noodle is cool.
Take out the noodle and dry out the water by keeping them in a dry bowl.
Heat up 1 liter (0.3 US gal) of water until it's warm enough put 300 grams of yellow beans.
Boil the yellow beans for 30 minutes and then add 500 grams of chicken or any meat.
Put in 100 grams of onion, 2 teaspoons of salt, 1 teaspoon of pepper and boiling eggs.
When the meat is cooked, put 200 grams of coconut milk.
steps.description: Keep it for 10 minutes and turn off the heat.

steps.headline: Chop 50 grams of parsley, 50 grams of onion, 50 grams of chilies and 2 lemons.
Now it's ready to serve.
steps.description: If you want a better taste, add more chilies and lemons so that you can have a hot coconut noodle.

text: Heat up 1 liter (0.3 US gal) of water. When it's already boiled, put down the noodle and wait until the noodle is soft and cooked. Pour down the cooked noodle in a bowl and add cold water in it until all of the noodle is cool.  Take out the noodle and dry out the water by keeping them in a dry bowl.  Heat up 1 liter (0.3 US gal) of water until it's warm enough put 300 grams of yellow beans.  Boil the yellow beans for 30 minutes and then add 500 grams of chicken or any meat.  Put in 100 grams of onion, 2 teaspoons of salt, 1 teaspoon of pepper and boiling eggs.  When the meat is cooked, put 200 grams of coconut milk. Keep it for 10 minutes and turn off the heat. Chop 50 grams of parsley, 50 grams of onion, 50 grams of chilies and 2 lemons.  Now it's ready to serve. If you want a better taste, add more chilies and lemons so that you can have a hot coconut noodle. Finished.
